title: Mile High Misery: Broncos' pass rush too much for Geno Smith, Raiders
content: The Broncos' league-leading pass rush dropped Smith six times, helping Denver to a seventh straight victory.

title: Ex-WR Brown arrested in Dubai, extradited to U.S.
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown was arrested on an attempted murder charge stemming from a shooting after a celebrity boxing event in Miami in May.

title: Sources: OF Tucker among 13 to get $22M offer
content: Kyle Tucker (Cubs) and Kyle Schwarber (Phillies) headline the 13 players who were tendered the $22.025 million qualifying offer Thursday, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones enters not guilty plea in NBA gambling case
content: Former NBA player and assistant coach Damon Jones pleaded not guilty Thursday to charges he profited from rigged poker games and provided sports bettors with nonpublic information about injuries to stars LeBron James and Anthony Davis.

title: Gators' 7-9 Rioux becomes tallest college player
content: Florida's 7-foot-9 center, Olivier Rioux, became the tallest person to ever play college basketball when he made his debut in a 104-64 victory over North Florida.

title: Odunze: Dad's shots at Bears don't speak for me
content: Chicago Bears wide receiver Rome Odunze said Thursday that his father's posts on social media are his prerogative, but that they don't speak for him.

title: Kelly: LSU 'journey' fell short of expectations
content: Former LSU coach Brian Kelly shared a statement on social media to fans Thursday, a little more than a week after he was fired.

title: Sources: DePodesta to run Rockies' baseball ops
content: The Rockies are finalizing a deal to hire Paul DePodesta to run their baseball operations department, sources told ESPN, turning to the longtime executive to overhaul a stagnant organization coming off a 119-loss season.

title: Wisconsin's Fickell to return in 2026, AD says
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell will return to lead the Badgers in 2026, athletic director Chris McIntosh announced on Thursday.

content: She was the No. 1 pick in the 2007 WNBA draft. She has played all over the world and coached through triumph and horror. Now, Harding is not only a leading voice for JJ Redick, LeBron and the Lakers, but is on the short list for future NBA head coaches.

content: The future Hall of Famer has hung up his spikes, but as L.A.'s dynasty continues, so will his influence.

content: Jake Paul has fought six fighters off his original wish list of 12. Now the YouTuber-turned-boxer shares a new list of opponents with ESPN.

title: Can anyone stop Kansas City? How each team will, won't win it all
content: It's playoff time in the NWSL, but can anyone stop the Kansas City Current from cruising to the title? Here's how every team could win it all -- and the one thing that might hold each of them back.

title: What to know ahead of Brazilian Grand Prix sprint weekend
content: Formula 1 has reached round 21 and heads to Interlagos, Brazil for the SÃ£o Paulo Grand Prix. Everything you need to know for the upcoming sprint weekend.

title: Sauce Gardner answers viral video with Colts jersey for young fans
content: A video went viral this week of a father informing his two young sons that one of their favorite players had been traded, with one breaking into tears.

title: Transfer rumors, news: PSG eye Barcelona defender GarcÃ­a
content: Paris Saint-Germain are keeping tabs on a possible move for Barcelona defender Eric GarcÃ­a. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Fake Satellite Signals Cause Major Flight Disruptions At Delhi Airport
content: Flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGIA) faced major disruptions this week after suspected GPS spoofing incidents.

title: "Rather Cut My Head": BJP Minister On Revanth Reddy Wearing Skull Cap At Rally
content: Bandi Sanjay's remarks drew immediate condemnation from opposition parties, who accused him of engaging in divisive, communal politics to gain an edge in the critical by-election.

title: Families Sue OpenAI, Say ChatGPT 'Counselled' Teen On Suicide
content: OpenAI is facing seven lawsuits claiming ChatGPT drove people to suicide and harmful delusions even when they had no prior mental health issues.

title: 3 Dead, 5 Trapped In South Korea Power Plant Tower Collapse
content: A 60-meter (196-foot) tower collapsed during demolition work at a decommissioned thermal power plant in the South Korean city of Ulsan, killing three people and leaving at least two others presumed dead, officials said Friday.

title: Israeli Male Hostage Accuses Gaza Captors Of Sexual Abuse
content: An Israeli hostage who was released in October has told an Israeli television channel he was subjected to sexual violence during his two-year captivity in Gaza by Palestinian militants -- the first male hostage to publicly make such an accusation.

title: 150 Years Of 'Vande Mataram': Traffic Restrictions In Delhi Ahead Of Event
content: Movement of vehicles on several key stretches in central Delhi is likely to be affected on Friday due to traffic restrictions and diversions in place for celebrations marking 150 years of the national song 'Vande Mataram', police said.

title: Meerut Drum Murder Case: Accused's Family To Leave City, Wants Fresh Start
content: Eight months after the killing of Saurabh Rajput, a shadow of the incident still looms large over Meerut's Indiranagar, where the family of the accused, Muskan Rastogi, resides and now prepares to leave the city.

title: Indian Student In Russia Steps Out To 'Buy Milk', Goes Missing, Body Found
content: The body of a 22-year-old Indian student, who went missing in Russia's Ufa city 19 days ago, was recovered from a dam on Thursday.

title: Twist After 6-Month-Old Baby's Death, Father Blames Wife, Lesbian Partner
content: The body of a six-month-old baby is expected to be exhumed today in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district for a fresh post-mortem, after the child's father alleged that the infant may not have died of natural causes, but could have been killed.

title: Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport Due To Technical Glitch In Air Traffic Control System
content: Flight operations at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport were affected on Friday morning due to a technical glitch in the Air Traffic Control (ATC) system.

title: West Bengal Schools To Now Sing State Anthem As Prayer Song
content: West Bengal government said that all state-run and state-aided schools will have the prayer song 'Banglar Mati Banglar Jol', penned by Rabindranath Tagore and earlier declared as the state anthem, from now on, along with the national anthem.

title: "Never Been To India": Brazilian Woman To NDTV Amid Rahul Gandhi's H-Bomb Row
content: Larissa Nery clarified that the viral picture was taken around eight years back when she was about 20 years old, adding that she got it clicked for a photographer friend.

title: "Super Appreciate It": Musk As Tesla Shareholders Accept $1 Trillion Pay Plan
content: Tesla shareholders on Thursday overwhelmingly endorsed a massive pay package for CEO Elon Musk that could reach $1 trillion.

title: Watch: Elon Musk Dances With Robot As Tesla Okays His $1 Trillion Pay Package
content: Elon Musk, the richest man in the world, just got richer after Tesla shareholders approved his pay package of nearly $1 trillion for over the next decade.

title: Google Plans AI Data Centre On Australia's Remote Indian Ocean Outpost
content: Google plans to build a large artificial intelligence data centre on Australia's remote Indian Ocean outpost of Christmas Island after signing a cloud deal with the Department of Defence earlier this year

title: US Claims 13 Strikes Since September Near Venezuela Coast, Killing Over 60
content: The US has reported carrying out 13 strikes since September on vessels near the Venezuelan coast and more recently, in the eastern Pacific Ocean, killing more than 60 people, according to the US secretary of defense

title: Over 750 Flights Cancelled As US Sees Travel Chaos Due To Government Shutdown
content: Travellers across the United States were left scrambling to rebook flights as the government shutdown heaps pressure on the country's air traffic control system, prompting hundreds of Friday flight cancellations at major American airports.

title: US B-52 Bombers Fly Near Venezuela Amid Trump's Crackdown Against Drug Vessels
content: A pair of US B-52 bombers flew over the Caribbean Sea along the coast of Venezuela on Thursday, flight tracking data showed, in the fourth such show of force by American military aircraft in recent weeks.

title: Trump Calls PM Modi A "Great Man", Hints At Possible India Visit Next Year
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi, calling him "a great man" and "a friend," while hinting that he may visit India next year as part of ongoing efforts to strengthen trade relations between the two nations.

title: Protesting Sugarcane Farmers Throw Slippers At Karnataka Minister's Car
content: Protesting sugarcane farmers in Karnataka allegedly threw slippers at State Minister Shivanand Patil's car when he was leaving the protest site in Belagavi on November 6.

title: Indian MBBS student found dead in Russian dam; was missing for 19 days
content: A 22-year-old Indian MBBS student, Ajit Chaudhary, missing for 19 days from Russia's Bashkir State Medical University, was found dead in a dam near the campus. His body was identified by fellow students, ending a desperate search that began after his clothes were found on a swollen riverbank. The family had sold land to fund his education.

title: Longer wait times, flight delays: Delhi airport ATC hit by technical snag; airlines issue advisory
content: Delhi Airport is experiencing significant flight delays since Thursday evening due to a software issue with the Aeronautical Message Switching System (AMSS) in air traffic control. This technical problem has slowed down flight movements, leading to stacked-up delays and impacting both departures and arrivals. Authorities are working to resolve the issue, with rectification expected by Friday evening.

title: Moments after $1 trillion pay nod: Musk breaks into dance with robot â€” who did it better?
content: Elon Musk celebrated a monumental Tesla payday, potentially worth $1 trillion, after shareholders overwhelmingly approved his compensation package. The deal, which could make him the world's first trillionaire, aims to secure his leadership for years, driving Tesla's ambitions in AI and robotics.  Despite controversies, investors backed Musk's vision, though critics raise concerns about concentrating so much power.

title: â€˜Fake vote, fake photoâ€™: Rahulâ€™s â€˜wholesale choriâ€™ charge at BJP; claims party will repeat it in Bihar
content: Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP of electoral malpractice, alleging "chunav chori" (election theft). He claimed systematic manipulation, citing Haryana as an example of "wholesale chori" and "one man, multiple votes," and stated the Prime Minister came to power through such means.

title: 'Change it!': Ex-IND pacer wants major rule removed after Gill LBW scare; urges ICC
content: A former India all-rounder urged the ICC to change a rule after Shubman Gill's review in the India-Australia T20I. He highlighted how a successful review, despite an inside edge, results in a dot ball and potential run loss, which could be critical in close matches. He believes this rule needs immediate attention to prevent future issues.

title: Peter Thielâ€™s warning resurfaces: What he predicted about Zohran Mamdani?
content: Tech titan Peter Thiel warned Silicon Valley in 2020 that rising millennial support for socialism stemmed from economic hardship, not ideology.  His foresight appears validated by Zohran Mamdani's election as New York's first Muslim and South Asian mayor on a platform of housing affordability and debt relief, highlighting a growing demand for alternatives to a perceived rigged capitalist system.

title: Watch: Trump's guest faints during White House event; netizens slam his 'too calm' response
content: A guest fainted during a White House event on lowering obesity drug costs, causing a temporary halt. The man, Gordon Finlay, representing a pharmaceutical company, received prompt medical attention. President Trump later confirmed the guest was fine, attributing the incident to lightheadedness and the long standing time in the Oval Office.

title: 2 killed as local Mumbai train ploughs through commuters at CSMT
content: A flash protest by Central Railway employees at CSMT halted suburban services for an hour, leading to a tragic incident where two commuters died and three were injured after being hit by a train while walking on tracks. The protest was against an FIR lodged following a previous accident.

title: Groww IPO day 3: GMP softens to 11% reaching Rs 111; should you subscribe?
content: Groww's IPO is on its final bidding day, having garnered significant retail investor interest and a 1.64 times subscription by Day 2. The platform's valuation stands at 33.8 times FY25 earnings, with a Rs 11 grey market premium indicating a potential listing price of Rs 111. Brokerages largely recommend subscribing, citing Groww's strong market position and growth potential.

title: Microsoftâ€™s next AI leap: Superintelligence project unveiled
content: Microsoft has launched a new team dedicated to advanced AI research, led by Mustafa Suleyman. Unlike some competitors pursuing generalist AI, this "MAI Superintelligence Team" will focus on specialist models designed to solve concrete problems with virtually no existential risk. The goal is "humanist superintelligence" aimed at practical applications that benefit humanity, such as improving healthcare and detecting diseases.

title: Women's World Cup: 'It still haunts me'- Alyssa Healy breaks silence on Australiaâ€™s defeat vs India
content: Australia captain Alyssa Healy admitted the heartbreaking semi-final loss to India in the ICC Women's World Cup still "hurts," despite her team's strong campaign. She believes Australia left runs on the field and struggled to adapt to the pitch conditions under lights, ultimately falling short in the knockout game.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for today? Why â€˜buy on dipsâ€™ makes sense
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are showing early recovery signs, prompting a 'buy on dips' strategy for investors. Technical indicators suggest a potential short-term trend reversal, with key support around â‚¹1,20,100. Analysts recommend entering around â‚¹1,20,600-â‚¹1,20,700, targeting â‚¹1,21,800, with a breakout potentially pushing prices to â‚¹1,22,200.

title: Jeff Bezosâ€™ ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes large donation; focus on education
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University $80 million, one of the largest single donations in its history, to support general operations and its College of Medicine. This significant contribution arrives as the university faces delays in federal funding due to a government shutdown. The donation continues Scott's recent pattern of substantial gifts to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives.

title: â€˜Govinda admitted, hum kya karein?â€™: IPS officer D Sivanandhan reveals how actors and musicians performed a show for Dawood Ibrahimâ€™s daughter
content: In the 1990s, Bollywood's glamour was overshadowed by underworld influence, with gangsters financing hit films like 'Satya' and 'Company' to enhance their image. Actors and producers lived under constant threat, forced to comply with demands from figures like Dawood Ibrahim, as revealed by former Joint CP Crime Mumbai D Sivanandhan.

title: They were visibly uncomfortable: Men seen forcing foreign tourists for photos on Goa beach
content: Goa authorities are cracking down on tourist harassment following disturbing incidents at Arambol and Vagator beaches.  Stricter patrolling and swift response mechanisms are being implemented to ensure visitor safety.  The tourism department emphasized that assault and intimidation will face severe action, urging establishments and visitors alike to uphold responsible conduct for a secure tourism environment.

title: Suryakumar Yadav loses his temper at Shivam Dube during 4th T20I vs Australia
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav showed rare frustration during the fourth T20I against Australia. Despite this brief moment, India secured a crucial 48-run victory, leveling the series. Washington Sundar's exceptional bowling performance led to a dramatic Australian collapse, securing the win for India.

title: What really happens inside your body when you hold your breath too long
content: Scientists explored how repeated breath-holding impacts the body.  A study found that practicing breath-holding techniques significantly increases endurance.  This improvement stems from the body becoming more efficient at balancing oxygen and carbon dioxide.  The repetition itself, rather than specific techniques, conditions the body.  This physiological adaptation allows for longer holds and quicker recovery.

title: Dodgers eye $80M ex-Cubs champion to boost roster and title hopes
content: Former MVP Cody Bellinger is reportedly a target for a blockbuster reunion with the Los Angeles Dodgers. After a strong showing with the Yankees, Bellinger opted out of his contract, making him a highly sought-after free agent. His return would bolster the Dodgers' lineup and defense, potentially aiding their championship aspirations.

title: Marshawn Kneeland girlfriend: Who is Catalina, the woman who loved the late Cowboys star?
content: The NFL community mourns Marshawn Kneeland, a promising 24-year-old Dallas Cowboys defensive end. His girlfriend, Catalina, alerted police during his final moments, revealing his struggles. Their relationship was private, built on mutual respect and shared values. Catalina, an entrepreneur, was his grounding force, supporting his career and remaining a private figure even after his tragic passing.

title: Gisele BÃ¼ndchen Says Prioritizing Tom Brady Took a Personal Toll
content: Supermodel Gisele BÃ¼ndchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. BÃ¼ndchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,400; BSE Sensex down over 450 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 went below 25,400, BSE Sensex was down over 450 points.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations:Bajaj Broking Research identifies Manappuram Finance and Dabur India as top stock picks for November 7, 2025. The Nifty is consolidating near a crucial demand zone, suggesting a healthy pullback within an uptrend.

title: 'You shut up ...': Ravi Shastri's epic advice to young Sachin amid Aussie sledging
content: Ravi Shastri recounted a fiery 1991-92 tour of Australia, advising an 18-year-old Sachin Tendulkar to let his bat do the talking amidst Australian sledging.  Shastri himself had a verbal spat with Mike Whitney, but urged Tendulkar, who was eager to retaliate, to rely on his immense talent. This advice shaped Tendulkar's legendary career against Australia.

title: Trump says India-US trade talks 'going good'; reiterates Russian oil claim
content: US President Donald Trump indicated positive trade talks with India and a potential visit next year, praising Prime Minister Modi. While negotiations for a Bilateral Trade Agreement continue, addressing significant tariffs on Indian goods and Russian oil imports remains a key focus for both nations aiming to boost trade.

title: Himachal mob beats up married man accused of stalking minor, blackens his face
content: A 37-year-old man accused of stalking and attempting to kidnap a 14-year-old girl in Sundernagar was beaten by a mob outside her home. Locals blackened his face and dragged him to the police station, where further confrontation occurred. Police have registered cases under Pocso Act and BNS.

title: US Supreme Court backs Trump admin's passport gender policy â€” what it means
content: The Supreme Court has allowed the Trump administration's policy to block transgender and nonbinary individuals from selecting passport sex markers aligning with their gender identity. This decision permits the policy to remain in effect during ongoing litigation, despite concerns from liberal justices about increased violence and discrimination against transgender people.

title: Woman's beheaded body found in drain in Noida
content: A woman's beheaded body was discovered floating in a drain near Noida's Sector 82, prompting a swift police response and the formation of three special investigation teams. Preliminary findings suggest the victim, appearing to be in her early 30s, was murdered 20-25 hours prior, with her body possibly dumped after being killed elsewhere to conceal her identity.

title: Antonio Brown net worth 2025: Inside the ex-Bucs receiverâ€™s earnings, endorsements, and shocking financial decline
content: Former NFL star Antonio Brown faces attempted homicide charges after being extradited from Dubai to Miami. This arrest adds to a career marked by financial ruin, with Brown filing for bankruptcy in May 2024, owing millions. His once-stellar career has dramatically fallen from grace, leaving him with significant debts and legal troubles.

title: US jury finds 'Sandwich guy' not guilty of assaulting border agent with sub
content: A US protester, Sean Dunn, was found not guilty of assaulting a CBP agent with a sandwich. Prosecutors, under a Trump-ordered crackdown, sought felony charges, but a jury acquitted him of a misdemeanor. The defense argued the prosecution was an abuse of power, questioning if throwing a soft object constituted an offense.

title: Tamil Nadu horror: Woman kills 5-month-old baby for lesbian partner; both arrested
content: A 25-year-old woman and her lesbian partner were arrested in Krishnagiri for the murder of the woman's five-month-old son. The mother allegedly suffocated the baby while her husband and other family members were at work. The partner is accused of plotting the murder, with evidence including text messages and intimate photos recovered.

title: 'KGF' actor Harish Rai passes away: Yash pays his last tribute to his late co-star
content: Kannada cinema mourns veteran actor Harish Rai, renowned for his roles in 'Om' and the 'KGF' franchise, who passed away after a battle with cancer. 'KGF' star Yash attended the funeral, offering condolences and support to Rai's grieving family. Rai, who had previously spoken of Yash's kindness, leaves behind a significant legacy in Indian cinema.

title: Is Jalen Green playing tonight vs Clippers? Latest update on Suns starâ€™s status
content: Phoenix Suns guard Jalen Green is poised for his season debut against the Los Angeles Clippers on Thursday, having recovered from a hamstring injury.  Green, a key acquisition in the Kevin Durant trade, is expected to start, forming a dynamic backcourt with Devin Booker. His return bolsters the Suns, who have started the season 3-5.

title: National Cancer Awareness Day: Date, history, significance
content: India observes National Cancer Awareness Day on November 7th, commemorating Marie Curie and raising awareness for prevention, early detection, and treatment. With cancer as a major health challenge, the day emphasizes healthier lifestyles, recognizing warning signs, and utilizing screening services to improve outcomes and reduce the disease's burden.

title: Who was Sulakshana Pandit? Why this singer-actress quit films after tragic love story
content: Veteran singer and actress Sulakshana Pandit passed away at 71 after a prolonged illness. Known for her soulful voice and graceful screen presence, she was part of a distinguished musical lineage. Her career spanned memorable songs and successful films, though she withdrew from the limelight after a personal tragedy.

title: Cardiologist reveals 9 proven ways to lower blood pressure naturally
content: High blood pressure can silently damage the heart, kidneys, and brain over time. Dr Evan Levine, a leading cardiologist, explains nine effective ways to bring blood pressure under controlâ€”without relying on medication. From improving diet balance to managing sleep and stress, these small yet powerful lifestyle changes can help maintain a healthy heart rhythm and blood flow naturally.

title: Saurabh Rajput murder case: 'House for sale' as Muskan's family plans to leave Meerut
content: There are only painful memories left here. We want to move out and start afresh, says Pramod Rastogi, Muskan's father

title: 150 years of 'Vande Mataram': PM releases stamp, coin
content: The song was written by Bankim Chandra Chatterji on the occasion of Akshaya Navami, which fell on November 7 in 1875

title: Farmer killed in tiger attack in Mysuru district, third such case in Saragur taluk in as many weeks
content: Prabhakaran, Deputy Conservator of Forests, Bandipur Tiger Reserve, said the village is at an aerial distance of 6 to 7 km from the site of the previously reported tiger attack

title: Tracking tumour burdens today, to transform tomorrow
content: Information on the cancer burden and survival rates are crucial to help formulate policy and ensure health system provide equitable care; the registries begun by Cancer Institute, Adyar have resulted in enriched surveillance in T.N., bringing in new information in the battle against the disease

title: Kumki elephants brought in to drive away rogue tusker in Kerala's Thrissur
content: The wild elephant has been frequently straying into Irumpupalam region at Kuthiran for past two weeks, creating panic among residents

title: Stray dog case hearing LIVE updates: SC orders fencing of government institutions to bar the entry of stray dogs
content: The suo motu case hearing is with respect to the dog bite issue in areas where employees in government and public sector office premises are supporting, feeding and "encouraging" the canines

title: 150 years on, 'Vande Mataram' continues to ignite eternal flame of nationalism: Amit Shah
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the year-long celebrations of the national song at the Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium

title: The evolving face of Bengaluruâ€™s darshinis
content: With a new wave of casual dining restaurants, regional South Indian cuisine is getting a makeover. What has long been relegated to roadside eateries is getting packaged in a smarter avatar. We speak to the people behind the new age darshinis of Bengaluru

title: Telangana bus-lorry crash: When bad roads and bad judgment collide
content: The stretch between Chevella and Manneguda on NH-163 has long been flagged by locals, commuters and road safety analysts as a death corridor: narrow lanes, poor lighting, unscientific curves and movement of heavy vehicles. One moment of reckless driving is all it takes for an ordinary commute to turn catastrophic. The November 3 crash between a State-run bus and a tipper lorry that claimed 19 lives is not an isolated tragedy but part of a chilling pattern.Â Lavpreet KaurÂ andÂ Naveen KumarÂ find that alleged infrastructure negligence and careless driving are not separate issues but two sides of the same threat

title: Why the nomination process needs reform | Explained
content: The Representation of the People Act (RP), 1951 mandates that only qualified candidates can contest an election. However, the process of verifying said qualifications has accumulated complexity over the years, with too much importance being laid on procedural technicalities than actual â€˜defects of a substantial characterâ€™

title: Advantage private varsities: Policy loopholes lead to imbalance in engineering seats in Karnataka
content: While AICTE permission is mandatory for government, aided and private engineering colleges to start new courses and enhancement of seats, policy loopholes are leading to an imbalance in engineering seats in Karnataka with private universities having no such obstacles, writes Jayanth R.

title: NGT seeks report from govt.on safety in firecracker units
content: A total of 134 people died and 89 were injured in accidents at firecracker units in Virudhunagar district alone since 2022; the Bench observed that most accidents could have been prevented

title: Naidu for North Andhra soon to fast-track irrigation projects, says Minister Ramanaidu
content: The Chief Minister has already directed officials to complete all major projects within the next two years with an outlay of over â‚¹2,000 crore, he says

title: A small plaque inÂ MylaporeÂ that keeps aliveÂ RabindranathÂ  Tagoreâ€™sÂ first visit to Madras
content: While visiting Madras in 1919, the Nobel laureate stayed at the residence of Justice T.Â MuthuswamyÂ Iyer, the first Indian to serve as a judge of the Madras High Court during the British period. In 2005, the descendants ofÂ IyerÂ sold the house to S. H.Â MohideenÂ  and his family, which chose to retain its historic name as a matter of pride

title: Pavalar Varadharajan, an artist who played key role in Communist Partyâ€™s victory in Kerala
content: TheÂ DevikulamÂ by-election in 1958 was crucial for theÂ NamboodiripadÂ government.Â To tap into plantation workers who were mostly Tamils, the Communist Party organised concerts byÂ PavalarÂ Varadharajan, whose songs went down very well with electors

content: What the Women in Blue pulled off at DYÂ PatilÂ Stadium,Â NaviÂ Mumbai, on November 2 rests on the hard work that a small army of Chennai women did over five decades ago.Â Shilu Ranganathan was the spearhead, who served the Tamil Nadu Womenâ€™s Cricket Association that organised tournaments at the school, collegiate, State and national levels

title: CBI registers FIR against ex-Punjab DGP, his wife in connection with their sonâ€™s death
content: The Haryana government requested the Centre to hand over the probe to the CBI. The case was earlier registered at the Mansa Devi Complex, District Panchkula, Haryana

title: Two Census apps, test portal for self-enumeration go live
content: Enumerators have been trained to use apps to help in digital collection and faster processing of Census data; the self-enumeration portal is open to the public in pre-test areas from November 1 to 7

title: Bengaluruâ€™s auto, cab driversâ€™ screen addiction raise alarm over road safety
content: According to police data, 34,303 cases were registered between January and September 2025 against motorists for using mobile phones while driving.

title: Mixed response to T.N. govt.â€™s proposed SOP for public meetings, rallies, road shows

title: Panneerselvam camp mulling the option of joining hands with DMK

title: Mystery lingers as a peaceful protest takes a violent turn in Kozhikode
content: The residents of Ambayathode village in Kozhikode, who have been peacefully protesting for six years against a poultry waste treatment plant, were recently caught in the middle of an arson and police action that resulted in heavy damage to property and injuries to many people. The dust has settled somewhat, but the villagersâ€™ complaints about pollution persist. Mithosh Joseph attempts to get to the bottom of the issue

title: NHL prospect pipeline rankings: Sharks, Islanders, then ...?
